docs.snippet: A video posted on social media sites on Saturday showed members of the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria beheading a soldier captured when militants seized a Lebanese border town.
docs.lead_paragraph: A video posted on social media sites on Saturday showed members of the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria beheading a soldier captured when militants seized a Lebanese border town.
docs.abstract: Members of Islamic State in Iraq and Syria behead Lebanese soldier Ali al-Sayyed, one of 19 captured after militants seized border town in Lebanon; militant group releases video documenting the beheading, and a second video showing nine other soldiers begging for their lives.

headline.main: ISIS Militants Behead Lebanese Soldier and Hold 18 More
headline.print_headline: ISIS Militants Behead Lebanese Soldier and Hold 18 More

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)

docs.snippet: Israel responded to the attack with artillery fire toward two Hezbollah positions in southern Lebanon, according to the Israeli military.
docs.lead_paragraph: Israel responded to the attack with artillery fire toward two Hezbollah positions in southern Lebanon, according to the Israeli military.
docs.abstract: Hezbollah sets off explosive device on the Israeli-controlled side of border with Lebanon, wounding two Israeli soldiers; Israel responds with artillery fire toward two Hezbollah positions in southern Lebanon; incident ends months of relative quiet along border.

headline.main: Hezbollah Attack Along Border With Lebanon Wounds Two Israeli Soldiers
headline.print_headline: Hezbollah Attack Wounds Two Israeli Soldiers

byline.contributor: Isabel Kershner reported from Jerusalem, and Anne Barnard from Beirut, Lebanon. Hwaida Saad contributed reporting from Beirut.
byline.original: By ISABEL KERSHNER and ANNE BARNARD

docs.snippet: Daniel Drennan, now known as Daniel Ibn Zayd, rediscovered his Lebanese heritage and converted to Islam after he began seeking answers about his adoption as an infant by an American family.
docs.lead_paragraph: Daniel Drennan, now known as Daniel Ibn Zayd, rediscovered his Lebanese heritage and converted to Islam after he began seeking answers about his adoption as an infant by an American family.
docs.abstract: Mark Oppenheimer Beliefs column highlights interview with Daniel Drennan, born in Beirut in 1963, and adopted by New Jersey couple through a Roman Catholic orphanage; Drennan, who has returned to Beirut and converted to Islam, is an anti-adoption activist who sees adoption a way that wealthier families and wealthier parts of world absorb children of families whose poverty they had a role in causing.

headline.main: Lebanese Adoptee, Searching for His Roots, Finds Islam
headline.print_headline: Lebanese Adoptee, Searching for His Roots, Finds Islam

docs.snippet: Dozens more Lebanese soldiers were captured in an armed offensive by Islamist fighters, the country’s army chief said, in the most recent spillover from the civil war in neighboring Syria.
docs.lead_paragraph: Dozens more Lebanese soldiers were captured in an armed offensive by Islamist fighters, the country’s army chief said, in the most recent spillover from the civil war in neighboring Syria.
docs.abstract: Islamist fighters from Syria kill 10 Lebanese fighters and appear to capture over dozen others in armed battle for control of Lebanese border town of Arsal.

headline.main: Fighters From Syria Kill 10 Lebanese Soldiers in Battle Over Border Town
headline.print_headline: 10 Lebanese Soldiers Killed in Spillover From Syria

byline.contributor: Ben Hubbard contributed reporting from Gaza.

docs.snippet: Security posts and homes were also attacked on Saturday by gunmen who were thought to be Syrian rebel fighters working to win the release of one of their own.
docs.lead_paragraph: Security posts and homes were also attacked on Saturday by gunmen who were thought to be Syrian rebel fighters working to win the release of one of their own.

headline.main: Gunmen From Syria Hit Army Checkpoints in Lebanon
headline.print_headline: Gunmen From Syria Hit Army Checkpoints in Lebanon

docs.snippet: The fighting in the Lebanese town of Arsal appeared to be the worst spillover into Lebanon since the Syrian conflict began more than three years ago.
docs.lead_paragraph: The fighting in the Lebanese town of Arsal appeared to be the worst spillover into Lebanon since the Syrian conflict began more than three years ago.
docs.abstract: Fighting between Lebanon's armed forces and Islamist insurgents from Syria worsens in most serious spillover of Syrian civil war in Lebanese territory to date; Lebanese Army counts its casualties from three days of fighting at 14 soldiers killed, 86 wounded and 22 missing; more than 20 Islamist fighters are also believed to be among those killed, but it is impossible to determine precise numbers.

headline.main: Border Fighting Intensifies Between ISIS and Lebanon
headline.print_headline: Border Fighting Intensifies Between ISIS and Lebanon

byline.contributor: Hwaida Saad reported from Beirut, and Rick Gladstone from New York.
byline.original: By HWAIDA SAAD and RICK GLADSTONE

docs.snippet: Three years after the United States left Iraq, its return to the region is getting a less than enthusiastic welcome, with allies finding ways to avoid specific commitments to an expanded effort against Sunni extremists.
docs.lead_paragraph: Three years after the United States left Iraq, its return to the region is getting a less than enthusiastic welcome, with allies finding ways to avoid specific commitments to an expanded effort against Sunni extremists.
docs.abstract: Return of United States to Middle East three years after withdrawing from Iraq is getting a less than enthusiastic welcome among Arab nations; leading allies like Egypt, Jordan and Turkey are all finding ways to avoid specific commitments to Pres Obama's expanded effort against Islamic State in Iraq and Syria; thirteen years of chaos have deepened political and sectarian divisions and increased mistrust of US on all sides.

headline.main: Arabs Give Tepid Support to U.S. Fight Against ISIS
headline.print_headline: Arabs Give Tepid Support to U.S. Fight Against ISIS

docs.snippet: In videos and photographs, Doctors Without Borders has documented its work in and around Syria, illustrating the far-reaching medical needs of a bloody and long-lasting civil war.
docs.abstract: In videos and photographs, Doctors Without Borders has documented its work in and around Syria, illustrating the far-reaching medical needs of a bloody and long-lasting civil war.

headline.main: How Doctors See the Syrian Civil War

docs.snippet: Turkey’s deputy prime minister said the Islamic State’s advance was causing a crisis “worse than a natural disaster” in his country.
docs.lead_paragraph: Turkey’s deputy prime minister said the Islamic State’s advance was causing a crisis “worse than a natural disaster” in his country.
docs.abstract: More than 130,000 refugees have flooded into Turkey from Syria, fleeing attacks by Islamic State militants; Turkey already has more than one million Syrian refugees on its hands, including 200,000 living in camps near the border.

headline.main: Raids by ISIS Push Flood of Refugees Into Turkey
headline.print_headline: Raids by ISIS Push Flood of Refugees Into Turkey
